paper_abstract: Selection of relevant variables from a high dimensional process operation setting space is a problem frequently encountered in industrial process modeling This paper presents two global relevancy criteria which permit to formalize and combine the sensitivity of experimental data and the conformity of human knowledge using a liner and a fuzzy model respectively The performances of these relevancy criteria and some well-known selection methods are compared through artificial and real datasets The result validates the outperformance of fuzzy global relevancy criterion especially when the number of learning data is small and noisy (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd All rights reserved
paper_title: Selection of relevant variables for industrial process modeling by combining experimental data sensitivity and human knowledge
